General course objectives:
General course objectives
The aim of the course is to move from a business idea to a proof-of-concept stage that will be tested, validated and if necessary, changed.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
develop and test pretotypes/prototypes and a minimal viable product (MVP)
calculate the size and potential of different markets to select a beached market
analyse competitive market dynamics by taking macro factors into account
determine a projects profiting losses for the business idea for 24 months after the launch date
explain the essence of the business idea in a convincing pitch
communicate the business idea effectively to different audiences and situations (e.g. having created pitch variations for sales vs. elevator pitches)
create a pitch deck that entails all major elements for an investment due diligence process
select a go-to market strategy based on various data sources
Content: Supervised group work on the students' start-ups with a special focus on building the product/service.
Remarks: Students must have taken the courses 38201, 38203, 38204 before.
